title: Telehealth Practical Competency Enhancement Course Based on Nursing Simulation: Scientific Inquiry and Patient Safety-Centered Approach

context.prior_knowledge: Possession of intermediate-level professional knowledge and problem-solving skills, understanding of basic scientific inquiry methods (observation, hypothesis formulation, experimental design), and foundational knowledge of the nursing process (assessment-diagnosis-planning-implementation-evaluation)
context.additional_context: Learners access LMS, perform simulation modules, and participate in asynchronous discussions using personal devices. Learning environment emphasizes patient data analysis based on scientific methodologies and evidence-based practice (EBP) application.

learning_goals: Perform a 5-step scientific process (hypothesis setting-variable control-observation-analysis-conclusion) for systematically evaluating patient symptoms in telehealth environments with 80% accuracy
Select evidence-based nursing interventions for three types of chronic disease patients through virtual simulation scenarios and measure their effectiveness

Learners can structure patient information (diagnosis, treatment plan, medication history, etc.) in electronic documents with over 90% accuracy according to KCDC guidelines for telehealth medical record writing and complete documents including at least 8 of 10 required items using provided templates
Explain four scientific verification items for ensuring patient safety when using digital therapeutic tools: equipment validation, data encryption, emergency protocols, and user education
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
